episodes.title: Not Your Property: How Purity Culture Stole Our Bodily Autonomy | Worldwide Church of God | Cults
episodes.description:
Welcome to another fiery conversation with the Apostate Sisters! This time, we’re diving into the tangled mess that is Purity Culture – that set of beliefs that told us our bodies belonged to God, our parents, or a future spouse, but certainly not to ourselves. Growing up in the Worldwide Church of God, purity wasn’t just about abstaining from sex; it was about surrendering every ounce of bodily autonomy. In this episode, we share our personal experiences and dissect the messages that trained us to disconnect from our own bodies.

We talk about how purity culture is woven with manipulation tactics, shame, and fear – and we explore the serious psychological and relational consequences of growing up under these beliefs. From modesty expectations and guilt-ridden messages to the toxic idea that “purity” equals worthiness, we break down the impact these teachings had on our lives and the lives of so many others.

Join us as we reclaim our autonomy, call out the harm, and share steps toward healing. This one’s for everyone who’s been made to feel like their body was anything other than their own. Ready to challenge these damaging ideas? Let’s get into it!

Join our Patreon: Patreon.com/ApostateSisters
LinkTree: https://linktr.ee/apostatesisters

episodes.title: Cult Indoctrination Through Media: The Worldwide Church of God presents The World Tomorrow
episodes.description:
We’re reacting to a bizarre 1950s-style dance routine performed by members of our former cult, the Worldwide Church of God. With its over-the-top wholesome vibe and oddly staged smiles, it’s clear that Herbert W. Armstrong had a vision of "perfection" that was as controlling as it was unsettling. From the forced cheer to the choreographed moves, the whole setup feels like an eerie attempt to project an image of moral superiority and "purity."
Join us as we cringe, laugh, and dissect the ways high-control groups often use aesthetics to enforce conformity and create a carefully curated "perfect" world. What might seem like harmless dancing at first glance has us diving deep into the image Armstrong wanted his followers to project—and the rigid control lurking behind that picture-perfect facade.

Tune in every other Friday night at 9pm Central for more live reactions to cult TV. Don’t forget to like, subscribe, and share with anyone curious about cult indoctrination through media! 

#UnPackItTV #CultSurvivor #Exvangelical #WorldwideChurchofGod #HerbertWArmstrong #ReligiousTrauma #DoomsdayCult

episodes.title: Cult Leader Herbert W. Armstrong's Endless Search for Pleasure - The World Tomorrow | UnPack-It TV
episodes.description:
Welcome to UnPack-It TV, a new live reaction series where Nancy and I (Patti) dive into the twisted world of Worldwide Church of God media. Our first focus is The World Tomorrow—Herbert W. Armstrong’s televangelist show that pushed WCG’s doomsday doctrines and rigid control right up until his death in 1986. But we won’t stop there! We’re ready to react to any WCG and cult-related videos, from old sermons and “educational” broadcasts to promotional material from affiliated groups.

As former insiders, we’re here to watch, comment, and irreverently unpack the manipulative messaging, fear-mongering, and bizarre teachings that shaped our lives growing up in this high-control cult. You can expect a heavy dose of humor, raw honesty, and critical analysis as we shed light on the authoritarian grip this media held over its members.

Join us live as we take back the narrative, laugh at the absurdity, and confront our shared past. Whether you’re a former member or just curious about cult influence, religious manipulation, and exvangelical journeys, UnPack-It TV is here for you. Subscribe to catch every episode as we bring truth, humor, and healing to the cult videos that once ruled our lives.

episodes.title: An Atheist in Kentucky? Joe in Conversation with the Apostate Sisters |
episodes.description:
In this episode of the Apostate Sisters Interview Series, we sit down with Joe from the Kentucky Atheist channel. Growing up in Eastern Kentucky, Joe’s journey from faith to reason wasn’t an easy one, especially in an area where the atheist community is small and religion is deeply embedded. Now, he’s committed to bringing a thoughtful, science-based perspective to his channel, covering topics like physics, cosmology, history, and astronomy. Joe challenges the role of religion in stifling rational thought and encourages his viewers to think critically.

Join us as we dive into Joe’s story, his experiences navigating faith and skepticism, and his mission to educate and foster open-mindedness in his community and beyond. Whether you’re from a similar background or just curious about atheism in a predominantly religious region, this conversation is packed with insights, authenticity, and the power of questioning.

Tune in to hear Joe’s perspective, and don’t forget to check out the Kentucky Atheist channel for more content that sparks curiosity and challenges beliefs!

episodes.title: Purity Culture: The Impact of Shame on Our Bodies and Minds
episodes.description:
In this clip, we dive into the deep impact of purity culture and its erasure of sexuality. Growing up with the message that our sexuality is inherently “bad” left us with shame and guilt, creating a disconnect from a natural part of being human. Even when teachings claimed that sex could be “good” within specific contexts, it did little to counteract the heavy shame we carried. We explore how purity culture robs us of a healthy, integrated sense of self, making it harder to feel whole and happy.

#CultRecovery #ChurchAbuse #ChristianityHurtsPeople #PraiseJesus #HerbertWArmstrong #WorldwideChurchOfGod

episodes.title: The Evangelical Illusion of Empowerment: Purity Culture Exposed - Herbert W. Armstrong Cult
episodes.description: In this clip, we unpack the illusion of choice in purity culture. Whether in evangelical spaces or the strict control of the Worldwide Church of God, girls and women are taught to "choose" modesty and self-sacrifice—but is it really a choice, or just control wrapped in empowerment language? We discuss how purity culture imposes a false sense of autonomy, making it seem like women have agency while pressuring them to conform to rigid standards or face consequences. Let’s break down the facade of “choice” in these high-control religious environments.

episodes.title: Fear​​fully and Wonderfully Made | Herbert W. Armstrong Talks Genitalia UnPack-It 15
episodes.description:
In this episode of UnPack-it, Patti, Nancy, and Joel dive into Chapter 10 of the Worldwide Church of God’s infamous text, taking on its claims about humanity’s “true potential” and “dignity.” We discuss the WCG's take on what it means to be “fearfully and wonderfully made” and its ambitious vision of humanity ruling over the entire universe—if, of course, we follow the church’s rules.

We take on the mixed messaging about human worth, bodily control, and the supposed divine hierarchy, all while examining how these teachings impacted WCG members' self-worth, bodily autonomy, and worldview. With our usual blend of humor and no-nonsense critique, we explore how ideas of "divine dignity" got twisted into controlling doctrine. Join us as we unpack the contradictions and laugh (or cringe) at the wild concepts that shaped our pasts.

episodes.title: Playing God: David Fitzgerald on Mythology & the Origins of Faith
episodes.description:
In this lively episode of the Apostate Sisters Interview Series, Nancy and Patti sit down with author and historian David Fitzgerald for a fascinating deep-dive into the world of mythicism, ancient history, and secular exploration. David is known for his work on the historical (or mythological) Jesus, challenging the widely held belief that Jesus of Nazareth was a real historical figure. In our conversation, David shares insights from his mythicist perspective and discusses how attitudes toward atheism and mythicism have evolved over the last decade. We also touch on his creative endeavors, including writing erotica with his wife and his past musical career that earned him a spot in the Las Vegas Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.

Expect some laughs as we explore the timelines of biblical figures, compare notes on ancient myths, and hear David’s unique journey from faith to secular activism. Whether you're into religious history, mythicist theories, or just enjoy a good laugh, this episode has a little something for everyone. Join us as we uncover the mystery behind the myth and get a peek into David Fitzgerald’s world of history, humor, and atheistic inquiry!

🔗 Check out David's work: davidfitzgerald.org
David's Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/sfkilt/

👍 Support the Apostate Sisters on Patreon: patreon.com/ApostateSisters

episodes.title: S2 E2: Physical Discipline Breaking the Cycle of Religious Control
episodes.description:
Welcome back to another episode of Apostate Sisters! This time, Nancy and Patti are diving deep into a tough but necessary topic: spanking and physical punishment, and how these practices intersect with bodily autonomy, especially in high-control environments like the Worldwide Church of God (WCG). Growing up in a church where authority and obedience were emphasized, many of us were raised to accept physical punishment as "normal" or even "loving" discipline. But what are the real impacts of this practice on our sense of self, safety, and autonomy?

In this episode, we discuss:

Our personal stories around spanking in WCG and evangelical households.
How spanking was justified by religious teachings and cultural norms, especially passages like "spare the rod, spoil the child."
The psychological toll of corporal punishment on children, including struggles with self-worth, boundaries, and bodily autonomy.
A look at shifting societal views on physical discipline and alternative, non-violent approaches to parenting.
Join us as we unpack the complex layers of spanking, authority, and control, and how we can reclaim our bodies and minds from these lasting imprints. If you find these discussions valuable, consider joining our Patreon community, Sinful Siblings, where you can connect with us and support our mission to create healing spaces for others. Patreon.com/ApostateSisters

episodes.title: Ex-Pastor with a People Centric Message sits down with the Apostate Sisters | Darante' LaMar
episodes.description:
In this episode of the Apostate Sisters Interview Series, we’re sitting down with Darante' LaMar, a relatively new voice in the atheist community, who shares his perspective on how atheism can be a force for positive change in the world rather than just a tool to prove who’s right. Darante' is a Black atheist from Alabama, and is passionate about building a world that works for more people. Together, we dive deep into pressing issues around race, houselessness, and religion, while specifically addressing how allies should interpret and engage with the message of "Black Lives Matter" versus the movement and organization itself. We thank Darante' for his trust in us to engage in these topics on our channel.

This candid conversation highlights the intersection of racial issues with atheism, challenging the atheist community to be more than just non-believers but active participants in creating a better world. Join us as we discuss how we can build more inclusive communities that prioritize equality and understanding, rather than just intellectual superiority. It's a conversation you don’t want to miss!

episodes.title: From Hormones to Human Creation: UnPack-It 14 | Worldwide Church of God | Herbert W. Armstrong
episodes.description:
In this episode of UnPack-It, Patti, Nancy, and Joel dive deep into the second half of Chapter 9 of Herbert W. Armstrong's The Missing Dimension in Sex. We explore Armstrong's fascination with male hormones and testicular function, including some wild experiments with castration. 😳

We also get into the intricate biological mechanics that Armstrong uses to argue divine design, specifically around the testes’ role as hormone factories and temperature-sensitive “laboratories.” And while Armstrong claims divine intervention, we take a moment to weigh that against scientific evolution.

Are we just biological marvels, or is there more to the story? Join us as we break down Armstrong's assertions and explore the WCG's ongoing obsession with bodily control.

Tune in for some surprising revelations (and laughs) as we continue to dissect The Missing Dimension in Sex. Make sure to like, comment, and subscribe for more episodes as we explore these old, high-control teachings through a critical lens.

episodes.title: Kerry Walker talks Cult Healing and Philosophy - The Clergy Project | Jehovah's Witnesses | WCG RCG
episodes.description:
Discover the profound journey of Kerry Walker, a former Jehovah's Witness, as he navigates the relentless demands of his church and the painful truths of his upbringing in our latest Apostate Sisters interview. Kerry shares his experiences with the extreme expectations set by his faith—engaging in ministry daily, attending frequent meetings, and the intense indoctrination that shaped his youth.

Kerry's escape from religious thinking through philosophy highlights the struggles many face when questioning their beliefs. His story provides invaluable insights for former Jehovah's Witnesses, ex-pastors, and anyone curious about the mechanics of cult control.

Additionally, we delve into the supportive network of The Clergy Project, an online community designed for religious leaders transitioning away from belief. This initiative offers crucial resources for those seeking new paths in life, emphasizing security, anonymity, and mutual support among its diverse members. For more on The Clergy Project and its services, visit: https://clergyproject.org/

Join us as we explore the impacts of high-control groups and the liberating journeys of those who break free. Whether you're navigating your departure from religion or seeking understanding of these complex dynamics, this conversation aims to offer solidarity, enlightenment, and a path forward.

episodes.title: Meet Ashlen Hilliard, Cult Intervention Specialist | People Leave Cults
episodes.description:
Join us for our conversation with Ashlen Hilliard, founder of People Leave Cults, as we explore the challenging yet transformative paths of cult survivors towards healing and freedom. In this episode, Ashlen shares her insights from her personal journey out of the Church of Christ and her professional work in aiding others to rebuild their lives post-cult.

Discover the roles of professional and peer support in recovery, and learn about the specialized resources available for survivors and their families through People Leave Cults and the Spiritual Abuse Forum for Education (SAFE).

For those looking to understand more about the impact of coercive control and how to navigate the challenges post-cult, this interview offers crucial perspectives and supportive resources. Whether you're a survivor yourself or know someone in need of guidance, Ashlen's expertise and empathetic approach provide a beacon of hope and a roadmap for recovery.

episodes.title: From Advertiser to Cult Leader: The Rise of Herbert W. Armstrong and the Radio Church of God
episodes.description:
We look at he early life of Herbert W. Armstrong, the founder of the Worldwide Church of God, and explore how his failed business ventures led him to build one of the most manipulative religious movements of the 20th century. Discover how he honed his persuasive style, got into radio broadcasting, and eventually founded the Radio Church of God, using his voice and free literature to draw in followers. This is the origin story of a man whose reach extended far beyond the pulpit, into the homes and minds of thousands.

episodes.title: S1 E19: Cult Tactics - The Wheel of Power and Control, Part 2
episodes.description:
In this episode of the Apostate Sisters podcast, Nancy and Patti continue their commentary and insights into the Religious/Spiritual Abuse Wheel of Power and Control from Empathy Paradigm Therapy. This second installment focuses on three critical aspects: Isolation + Insulation, Loss of Autonomy, and Justification.



We explore how these tactics are used to control and manipulate individuals within high-control groups and beyond, including:


     
      
  •  Isolation + Insulation: Physical and emotional separation, restricted access to outside support, insider/outsider language, and censorship.
     
      
  •  Loss of Autonomy: Continuous monitoring, denial of privacy, and undermining self-trust.
     
       
  •  Justification: Gaslighting, victim-blaming, and invoking the greater good to rationalize abusive behaviors.
     
     


Our conversation includes personal stories and examples from organized religions, mainstream society, and governmental systems. We discuss the impact of these tactics and how they perpetuate abuse, drawing from our own experiences of being told we were disciplined out of love.



Listen in to better understand these manipulative practices and how to protect yourself and others from their harmful effects.



#SpiritualAbuse #ReligiousAbuse #ControlTactics #Isolation #AutonomyLoss #Justification #EmpathyParadigmTherapy #ApostateSisters #Deconstruction #HealingJourney

We discuss:

Isolation + Insulation: Physical and emotional separation, restricted access to support and resources, insider/outsider language, and censorship of information.
Loss of Autonomy: Constant contact, denial of privacy, and the erosion of self-trust.

episodes.title: Exposing the Upper Echelons of the Worldwide Church of God: Deni Azeredo's Story
episodes.description:
Join us for a revealing interview with Deni Azeredo, a Brazilian American who now resides in Brazil. Deni's unique perspective as someone who grew up in the Worldwide Church of God offers an inside look at the intricate and often perilous dynamics of this high-control group.

Deni's father worked at the church headquarters in Pasadena as a groundskeeper and Portuguese translator, placing their family in close proximity to the church's leadership. Deni attended the prestigious Imperial Schools and was one of the 'Little Ambassadors,' performing with children from around the globe to bolster the church’s image.

In this episode, Deni shares his firsthand experiences navigating the upper echelons of the cult, detailing the backbiting and dangerous political games among the leaders. He provides an intimate look at the controlling world of Herbert W. Armstrong, shedding light on the complex power dynamics and the constant maneuvering for favor and position within the church's hierarchy.

Beyond his childhood and adolescent years, Deni also recounts his time in the military, including his service in Iraq, offering a comprehensive view of his journey from a child within a powerful cult to a seasoned veteran.

Don't miss this in-depth exploration of life inside the Worldwide Church of God and the personal journey of someone who lived through its inner workings. Like, comment, and subscribe for more eye-opening interviews and discussions.

episodes.title: A 60s Childhood in the Worldwide Church of God: David Ward's Story
episodes.description:
Welcome to a new episode of the Apostate Sisters Interview Series, where we hold space for the life stories of those who were once entangled in the web of the Worldwide Church of God. Today, we're joined by David Ward, who was introduced to the church in his early childhood in the mid-1960s and left as a teenager in the late 1970s.

Raised in a family deeply committed to the church after his father discovered "The Plain Truth" magazine, David's upbringing was steeped in the doctrines and practices of the church, from observing the Sabbath to attending the impressive Ambassador Auditorium for holy days. Despite the church's deep influence, David recounts his journey with a reflective and critical eye, especially discussing his transition away from these beliefs during his pursuit of higher education.

Today, while his mother and some siblings still observe the church's teachings, David identifies as an atheist, maintaining a nuanced view of his time within the church. This episode explores the complex dynamics of growing up in a cult, the allure of questioning, and the path to personal freedom. Join us as David shares insights into the everyday life aspects of cult membership, including youth camps, relationships, and the impact of church doctrines on personal decisions like dating and education.

David's story is a testament to the power of questioning and the search for personal truth. As we unpack his experiences, we invite our listeners to reflect on their own journeys and the impact of religious teachings on personal growth and freedom.

episodes.title: S1 E13: Screwdrivers & Spectacles - The Life and Influences of Herbert W. Armstrong, Part 2
episodes.description: In this poignant episode of "Apostate Sisters," we sift through the public face of a man whose legacy continues to resonate through time, impacting countless lives with his teachings. Armstrong, a charismatic leader whose adept use of burgeoning media transformed his apocalyptic visions into a global message, didn't just shape doctrines; he shaped destinies. We explore the human aspect behind the spectacle, shedding light on the personal stories of those who grew up under the shadow of Armstrong's prophecy, particularly the year 1975, which was predicted to bring the end but instead left a legacy of confusion and disillusionment. This episode doesn't just recount historical facts; it aims to give voice to the silent echoes of childhoods spent in preparation for an apocalypse that never came. We focus on the real human cost of Armstrong's teachings, the individuals still grappling with the remnants of fear instilled from a young age, and those finding themselves ensnared in the web of Armstrongist cults today. Join us as we unravel the complexities of Armstrong's influence, from the fervor of his media empire to the indelible marks left on the lives touched by his prophecy. This isn't just a bland retelling of the facts —it's a journey towards understanding, healing, and perhaps, integration for those still seeking to break free from the chains of their upbringing within the Worldwide Church of God and its offshoots. episodes.title: S1 E12: Bourbon & Spectacles - The Life and Influences of Herbert W. Armstrong, Part 1
episodes.description: In this first episode of a new series, we begin the riveting history of Herbert W. Armstrong. Nancy and Patti study the enigmatic founder of the Worldwide Church of God, through Nancy's detailed spreadsheet that requires Patti to don her reading glasses. As Nancy sips on bourbon, the sisters explore the religious movements dating back to the 1600s, unraveling the threads that may have woven together to shape their own childhood experiences within the cult. We take you on a journey from Armstrong's early days in the Midwest, where he honed his skills in sales, and then to Oregon, where his 'pioneering' venture into a radio program put him into the public eye and would eventually launch the Worldwide Church of God. The episode sheds light on the historical and cultural influences that Armstrong encountered throughout his life, offering insights into how these elements fused together to form the doctrines and practices that impacted countless lives. Join us, the Apostate Sisters, for an hour of history, analysis, and personal reflection, as we dissect the life of a man whose legacy is as controversial as it is captivating. Whether you're a former member of the Worldwide Church of God, a history buff, or simply intrigued by the dizzying clusterf*ck of religious movements, this episode promises to deliver the Sisters' irreverent style. Don't miss out on this deep dive into the life of Herbert W. Armstrong. Subscribe, like, and share your thoughts in the comments below. We're eager to hear your perspectives and experiences as we continue to explore the shadows and spectacles of religious history together. #HerbertWArmstrong #WorldwideChurchofGod #ReligiousHistory #ApostateSisters #CultHistory

episodes.title: Chasing Truth Beyond The Bible: Seeking Reality Led to Deconversion #shorts #Bible #Truth #Logic
episodes.description:
Patti shares a deeply personal revelation: her committed search for truth, a value instilled in her from a young age, ultimately guided her away from the church and led to her deconversion. Growing up in a religious environment where the pursuit of truth was paramount, Patti embarked on a journey to understand the world more deeply, only to find discrepancies between what the Bible claimed and the realities of the world.
This is not just Patti's story; it's a conversation starter for anyone who has ever dared to question their faith, seek answers beyond religious texts, and find their own path in the pursuit of truth. #Deconversion #SeekingTruth #ReligiousQuestioning #ApostateSisters #FaithJourney #TheBibleIsCulturalFiction

episodes.title: Patti was a Cringy Jesus Freak #ExChristian #CultSurvivor #shorts
episodes.description:
Apostate Sister Nancy shares a hilarious yet poignant memory of Patti, once fervently wandering her college campus singing about Jesus, a past action we now find utterly cringeworthy. As we look back on our journey away from a rigid faith, we uncover the layers of embarrassment associated with the practices we once held dear, recognizing the ridiculousness and societal harm of our previous beliefs.
This candid clip is a light-hearted glimpse into the deeper conversations we have about the evolution of our beliefs, the things we once did in the name of faith, and how we've come to see the error and harm in those actions. It's a relatable journey for anyone who's ever reflected on their past with a mix of disbelief and growth.
Join us as we laugh, cringe, and reflect on the paths we've taken from devout believers to critical thinkers, shedding light on the often ridiculous and harmful aspects of our former faith. #ExCult #FaithJourney #ReligiousDeconstruction #CringeConfessions #ApostateSisters

episodes.title: Obedience Destroys Confidence #shorts #CultSurvivor #worldwidechurchofgod
episodes.description: Apostate Sister Nancy explains how she had no sense of self, and no self-confidence because of our upbringing in the fear-based doomsday cult, the Worldwide Church of God. We reject and seek to end religious control over children, and we are part of a network of creators building a safety net for those seeking refuge from the cult, and healing from the trauma. #Armstrongism #ToxicReligion #HerbertWArmstrong #WCG #RCG #EndTime #Truth #Reality #Confidence #Deconversion #Deconstruction

episodes.title: S1 E11: From Silence to Swearing: Taking Back Our Words from Religious Gatekeeping
episodes.description: In this explosive episode of Apostate Sisters, Patti and Nancy share hilarious and horrible stories of their upbringing in the doomsday cult known as the Worldwide Church of God, revealing the intense control exerted over their language and expression. Growing up under the shadow of Armstrongism, they were forbidden from uttering swear words, discussing their body parts openly, or even using mild exclamations that took the Lord's name in vain. Now, they're not holding back. Prepare to be shocked, enlightened, or find yourself nodding in agreement as they tackle the concept of "gatekeeping language" as a method of control, and share their personal journey towards reclaiming their right to speak freely. This episode is a bold and irreverent critique of the language restrictions imposed by religious zealotry, and a celebration of the freedom found in breaking those chains. For anyone who's ever felt their voice was stifled by religious dogma or cultural censorship, this discussion is a liberating exploration of what it means to speak your truth. From "f*ck" to "fart" and everything in between, Patti and Nancy are reclaiming the words they were once punished for. Whether you're a survivor of the Worldwide Church of God or one of its offshoots, or someone who's navigated similar experiences of linguistic control, or simply fascinated by the intersection of language, culture, and religion, this episode is a must-listen. Let's break the taboos together and celebrate the power of words unchained. Join the conversation and share your own experiences with language control and liberation. Reach out to us on Instagram, and Like, Subscribe, and Comment on YouTube. Your voice matters, and it's time it was heard. Are you looking for a place to hang out where other survivors are sharing their stories and healing together? The Apostate Sisters now have a Discord server ready to meet those needs. Reach out via any of our socials to find out more.

episodes.title: God, Batman, and Answered Prayers - Apostate Sisters #shorts
episodes.description:
A childhood memory of praying for a favorite TV show evolves into questioning the very essence of divine intervention. This video explores the journey from accepting everything we're taught as children, through moments of innocent faith, to confronting the unsettling realities of unanswered prayers on a global scale. Why do some prayers seem answered while critical issues, like suffering and injustice, remain? Our story navigates the complexities of faith, the search for answers, and the path to finding peace in skepticism. Whether you're someone who has questioned your beliefs, someone in the midst of deconversion, or simply interested in the stories of others, this short narrative offers a reflective look at the challenges of reconciling faith with the realities of the world. #Deconversion #QuestioningFaith #Skepticism #Atheism #SpiritualJourney #FaithToDoubt

episodes.title: Harmony Over Dogma: Prioritizing Our Planet and Each Other
episodes.description: In a world divided by beliefs, the idea of a deity often becomes a barrier to unity and progress. We have a pressing need to set aside our theological differences and work together towards tangible goals: a cleaner planet, sustainable resource management, and fostering a culture of respect and non-traumatization. From an atheist standpoint, we focus on how common, secular objectives might be our best chance at achieving global harmony and environmental sustainability. Let's explore practical steps towards a future where humanity thrives on mutual understanding and shared responsibility. #Atheism #EnvironmentalSustainability #GlobalUnity #SecularHumanism #PeacefulCoexistence

episodes.title: Beyond Doomsday - from Christian Apocalypse to Sustainable Action #shorts #apostatesisters
episodes.description: Let's get thinking about shifting from apocalyptic expectations to facing the real-world challenge of climate change. Together we can transform our approach to sustainability. Unfortunately, misconceptions deter some Christians from environmental activism, due to the belief in an imminent Second Coming, and those regressive views align with capitalism's push for overconsumption. #christianity #doomsday #climatecrisis #ApostateSisters

episodes.title: Strange after effects of Religion at all levels - Apostate Sisters #shorts #worldwidechurchofgod
episodes.description:
We are the Apostate Sisters. We are sharing the profound and often overlooked aftermath of growing up in a cult. We share personal stories that reveal the lasting impact of their childhood indoctrination. Nancy opens up about her struggle with a seemingly simple act – closing her eyes in public – a residual fear stemming from forced prayers and the stringent, controlling environment of her youth. This sheds light on how the subtle yet insidious rules of a cult can linger in the minds and behaviors of those who have left. 

The Apostate Sisters' candid conversation on their podcast is not just a journey through their past, but a beacon for anyone on the path of deconstructing the faith of their childhood. Whether you're unraveling the threads of your own beliefs or simply curious about the process of religious deconstruction, this episode offers insights, empathy, and a reminder that you're not alone in the quest for personal freedom and truth.

If you're navigating the complexities of questioning your faith, seeking to understand the impact of religious upbringing, or just in need of a compassionate voice that resonates with your experiences, the Apostate Sisters for you. Tune in, as we invite you into their world of discovery, healing, and liberation from the shadows of dogma.

Subscribe to our channel for more episodes where we explore the journey of deconstruction, share stories of overcoming religious indoctrination, and offer support to those who are finding their way out of the shadows and into the light of their own truth.

episodes.title: S1 E10: Reclaiming Bodily Autonomy: Unveiling Purity Culture's Impact
episodes.description: Join Nancy and Patti, the Apostate Sisters, in a powerful episode that delves deep into the realms of purity culture and religious restrictions on women's bodies within traditional Christian communities. This heartfelt yet accusatory dialogue sheds light on the oppressive rules about marriage, makeup, dress codes, sex, and body image that many women have had to navigate. We openly discuss the harmful teachings that dictate a woman's body is not her own and the lasting effects these beliefs can have on one's sense of autonomy and self-worth. In this episode, we share our personal journeys and sexual paths, offering insights into how we've worked to reclaim our bodies and beliefs in the face of institutional abuse. Our discussion is not just a critique but a rallying cry for those looking to break free from the chains of purity culture and to embrace their bodily autonomy with conviction. Whether you've experienced these challenges firsthand or are seeking to understand the pervasive impact of these teachings, "Reclaiming Bodily Autonomy: Unveiling Purity Culture's Impact" is an essential listen for anyone looking to support bodily freedom and healing from religious constraints. Tune in to explore how we, and many others, are navigating the journey towards reclaiming what was once taken: the right to our own bodies and beliefs.

episodes.description: Join Patti and Nancy, the Apostate Sisters, as they delve into the controversial topic of birthday celebrations in their latest podcast episode. Raised in the Worldwide Church of God, a doomsday cult, they share their unique perspectives on why birthdays weren't celebrated and the psychological impacts this had on them. They blend a critical analysis of religious practices with personal anecdotes and historical insights into the origins of birthday celebrations. From Patti's longing to participate in school birthday traditions to Nancy's reflections on never receiving a wrapped gift, this episode is a blend of humor, history, and heartfelt discussion. Discover how their upbringing shaped their views on special occasions and how they navigate birthdays today. This episode is a must-listen for anyone interested in the intersection of religion, culture, and personal growth.

episodes.title: S1 E4: Unwrapping Pagan Roots: Apostate Sisters' Journey through Christmas in the Worldwide Church of God
episodes.description: Join the Apostate Sisters, Patti and Nancy, as they unwrap the layers of their childhood experiences in the doomsday cult, the Worldwide Church of God, and delve into the peculiar stance on Christmas. In this episode, the sisters explore the cult's rejection of the holiday, driven by the enigmatic figure, Herbert W. Armstrong. From the roots of paganism to Armstrong's controversial teachings, discover the emotional and psychological impact on the sisters and their unique perspective on the festive season. Get ready for a deep dive into history, religion, and personal reflections that challenge the commercialized narrative of Christmas. Whether you're nodding in agreement or shaking your head, this conversation will leave you questioning traditions and redefining the true meaning of the holiday season.

episodes.title: S1 E3: Keeping the Sabbath in the Worldwide Church of God
episodes.description: The Worldwide Church of God kept Saturday as its Sabbath from its inception in the 1930s. When Nancy and Patti were forced to participate in keeping the Sabbath as children in the 1980s, they complied with the rules to save their own skin from a god who wanted nothing more than obedience.

episodes.title: S1 E2: Forbidden Foods: WWCG Religious Restrictions
episodes.description: Patti and Nancy discuss what it was like growing up under ancient food laws during the 1980’s. Pork, bacon, and shellfish figure prominently, and we seek to learn about other religious and cultural food restrictive traditions. We dive into the social and emotional impacts wrought upon us as children while trapped in an extremist ideology, recapping what we have healed and where we still struggle.

episodes.title: S1 E1 The Worldwide Church of God
episodes.description: It turns out having been raised in a cult is kinda shitty. Here, we have a first on-the-record chat about the toxic religious control we experienced as children and where it's landed all of us in life. Herbert W. Armstrong, Brother Stair, and David C. Pack are among the guilty, victimizing our parents so they could victimize us. We argue for the death of thought control and obedience and will maintain that people who believe true things make better decisions. Come give cults and religion the finger with us.
